result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Carl Seymour was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: $2,000 was paid in full victim. Other portion of restitution will TBD at a restitution hearing.

Provide DNA sample.
Comply with conditions imposed by Agent.

RECOMMENDED
Cover Letter
#1- insurance claim for damages and car rental

2:19 Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court. Amber Madrid appeared for Progressive Auto Insurance. Ms Madrid: $3933.67 (damages to the vehicle and use of a rental vehicle). Atty Chapman does not dispute the amounts being claims, objects under 973.20(5)(d), civil judgment instead of restitution.  Court: denies Request for a civil judgment action. Criminal statutes allow for restitution. Justice does require this. Orders restitution in the amount of $3933.67.
Restitution hearing on January 19, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Andrew Carl Seymour in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. O'Sullivan amended information filed today, plead guilty, probation, $2000 restitution, restitution hearing to be set. Atty Chapman, defendant will pay $2000 to victim today.  Restitution calim for $3900 to insurance comapny, not agreeable.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.   DEF PLEADS GUILTY to count 1 in amended information-- misd. theft mov. prop.  Facts are correct.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of charge in amended information. Atty Chapman addresses the court. Court Orders: S/W 1 year, follow conditions set by agent, pay restitution $2000 to victim, court costs $443 (includes DNA surcharge) due over probation. Appeal rights are given to the defendant.  11:21
and Restitution Information and Affidavit of Claim (Douglas Hundley)
Plea hearing on December 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2016 at 11:45 am.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant. Court reads charges and possible penalties. Atty Chapman states that class H is not appropriate, should show class I.  Thorie agrees. Thorie provides new information with correction and copy is given to the defendant. Court orders 16CT1 dismissed.   Defendant enters not guilty plea at preliminary hearing.   Not guilty plea received by the court.   The bond will continue as ordered. 04:08

03:49 16CT1 following for scheduling. Defendant Andrew Carl Seymour in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie calls Deputy Westfield to the stand. Deputy Westfield is sworn in. Thorie examines Deputy Westfield. Atty Chapman redirects. Atty Chapman offers arguments. Thorie gives argument.  The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 22, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

04:20 16CT1 also heard at this time. Defendant Andrew Carl Seymour in court, in custody VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ. Attorney Liesl Nelson appears for the defendant via phone.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie: requests $1000 cash bond on 16CF1 and $500 cash bond on 16CT1.  Nelson objects to cash bond. Court orders reinstatement of both bonds, $5000 on 16CF1 and $2000 on 16CT1. Set for pre-trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

4:03 Defendant Andrew Carl Seymour in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Christopher Bub appeared in court. 16CT1 heard at this time.   Defendant has copy of complaints.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaints.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Thorie: $5000 signature bond in 16CF1. $2000 signature bond in 16CT1. Bub has no objection. Def has not been in the armed services.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 09:30 am.
